thread.title_full: Arsenal star tempts fate by firing warning to Bayern Munich on Twitter | Metro News

author: Sean Kearns For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal star tempts fate by firing warning to Bayern Munich on Twitter | Metro News

organizations.name: twitter | metro news follow us per mertesacker

text:
Follow us Per Mertesacker tempts fate by firing warning to Bayern Munich on Twitter ahead of Champions League clash Sean Kearns for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 15 Feb 2017 5:09 pm Per Mertesacker is confident ahead of Arsenal’s clash against Bayern Munich (Picture: Getty) 
Arsenal defender Per Mertesacker warned Bayern Munich that the Gunners ‘mean business’ just hours before the sides clash at the Allianz Arena tonight. 
The German is expected to start on the bench as Arsene Wenger’s side look to progress to the final eight of the competition for the first time since 2010. Paul Pogba shows brotherly love after Florentin is forced off injured 
The Frenchman is expected to make a number of changes to his side against Carlo Ancelotti’s men with Theo Walcott dropping to the bench. 
Arsenal’s record against Bayern Munich is poor but Mertesacker tempted fate by warning the Germans that the Gunners ‘mean business’ on Twitter earlier today. 
— Per Mertesacker (@mertesacker) February 15, 2017 
Gooners will be hoping the warning doesn’t come back to bite them later tonight…. More
